channel.title: I need help with my source
channel.description:
So.. I have a enkrona 3.3 source and I loved it in days back.. Everytime I run it it says Java Is Not Recognzied As A Internal Or External Operable Or batch file or w.e the crap it is.. SO... I went online and searched and it said I had to add my path witch I did and it still dosn't work... Here is what is in the source
@echo off REM TODO replace with ant :start title Enkrona java -Xmx300m -cp bin;deps/jython.jar;deps/mina-core-1.1.7.jar;deps/slf4j-api-1.5.6.jar;deps/slf4j-nop-1.5.6.jar Server goto start
I am running on windows XP 32 bit and I have Jre7...
here is what I put in my [b]path[/b]
;C:\Program Files\Java\jre7\bin And I tryed C:\Program Files\Java\jre7\bin - without semi-colon and it still dosn't work... I did the same for [b]CLASSPATH[/b]
If anyone has a solution Plz let me know... Here is all the java stuff I have downloaded
jre7 jre6 jre1.6.0_04
Plz let me know if I need JDK or something like that cuz I did download it

item.title: I need help with my source
item.dc:creator: @runescape_sucks runescape sucks
item.description:
@runescape_sucks wrote:

@echo off REM TODO replace with ant :start title Enkrona "C:\Program Files\Java\jre7\bin\java.exe" -Xmx300m -cp bin;deps/jython.jar;deps/mina-core-1.1.7.jar;deps/slf4j-api-1.5.6.jar;deps/slf4j-nop-1.5.6.jar Server goto start

Read full topic

item.title: I need help with my source
item.dc:creator: @lolkd4 lolkd4
item.description:
@lolkd4 wrote:

So… I have a enkrona 3.3 source and I loved it in days back… Everytime I run it it says Java Is Not Recognzied As A Internal Or External Operable Or batch file or w.e the crap it is… SO… I went online and searched and it said I had to add my path witch I did and it still dosn’t work…
Here is what is in the source

@echo off
REM TODO replace with ant
:start
title Enkrona
java -Xmx300m -cp bin;deps/jython.jar;deps/mina-core-1.1.7.jar;deps/slf4j-api-1.5.6.jar;deps/slf4j-nop-1.5.6.jar Server
goto start

I am running on windows XP 32 bit and I have Jre7…

here is what I put in my path

;C:\Program Files\Java\jre7\bin
And I tryed C:\Program Files\Java\jre7\bin - without semi-colon and it still dosn’t work…
I did the same for CLASSPATH

If anyone has a solution Plz let me know…
Here is all the java stuff I have downloaded

jre7
jre6
jre1.6.0_04

Plz let me know if I need JDK or something like that cuz I did download it

Read full topic
